page.title: 11Farming.
page.content: One family lived on a farm in our block between 1922 and 1984 and during that time saw many changes in rural life. In 1922 they made butter on the farm, and sold it at the local market,later their milk was put into churns and collected by lorry from a roadside milk-stand. They used horses to work the land and reared or grew most of their own food. Corn was taken to a local mill to be ground into flour. When they first came into the area very few motor vehicles were seen and this changed little until the 1940's when the first tractors were seen on local farms,these were followed by the occasional car or van. The family have been involved with the local "Garden Show"which began during the war to encourage crop growing.
